meanings.sent1: The freaky-looking bird had bright purple feathers.
meanings.sent2: It was a freaky coincidence that they wore the same outfit.
meanings.sent3: The freaky clown made everyone laugh with his silly tricks.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house had a freaky atmosphere, like something out of a horror movie.
meanings.sent5: The freaky sound coming from the attic gave me chills.

meanings.sent1: The freaky shadow in the dark alley scared me.
meanings.sent2: The freaky movie kept me up all night.
meanings.sent3: The freaky noise outside turned out to be just a stray cat.
meanings.sent4: The freaky mask at the costume party startled everyone.
meanings.sent5: The freaky figure lurking in the fog sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: Acting or behaving in a wild or erratic manner
meanings.sent1: Her freaky dance moves amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The freaky driver swerved dangerously between lanes.
meanings.sent3: The freaky squirrel darted across the park in a frenzy.
meanings.sent4: His freaky behavior at the party raised a few eyebrows.
meanings.sent5: The freaky cat chased its tail in circles around the room.
